lines.text: Give me the meanest steak you got! Rare, and I mean rare! Just de-horn it, wipe its butt and send it in.
If you ever leave me with a kid again I'll make sure you never have one. You have no idea what those screaming booger eaters are like. They expect you to... know stuff!

Okay, God, just... want you to look down on these girls here. They're like little flowers, and the rain you send 'em gutta be gentle and sweet. We come to you today, and we ask you to just... help 'em - help us grab this pageant by the balls and rip 'em off! I mean, if those judges don't like us, then screw 'em. These girls here - they're talented, they're pretty, and if those judges say anything different, then I hope that on Judgement Day you put their asses through a meat grinder!... Amen.
The Light IS GREEN!
Waddya mean "WE?" Did you grow another face?

[shows girls how to strut]
Because I've got my weight in my hip,
[slaps his hip]
weight in my hip.

[while being shot at]
JESUS... ON A... CRACKER!

You don't think I know what you're doin', do you? Goin' to the banker lady's house for popcorn and pillow talk. Goin' huntin'. What did you do tonight? Did you go someplace nice for dinner? Did you have a few drinks? Hmm? You don't think I'd like to get out some night or have a nice meal? Spend one night not thinkin' about the girls? You know what I did tonight? I'll tell you what I did. I spent it right here
[slaps sewing machine]
tryin' to figure out if slip-stitchin' or bastin' is the best way to put on a sparkly heart. Because you know what? I don't know how.
[gasps]

The pageant judges are gonna be here tomorrow. Madison's not gotten all the way through her song. The numbers are all over the place. Nobody can keep the beat. And I'm scared to death that Jensy is gonna drop her
[fire]
baton and fry like a Buddhist monk!
Why did the armadillo cross the road?
Why?

[Holds up dead armadillo]
It didn't. Look, see?
Hey, maybe we are tailors. We travel from town to town, tailoring dresses, for circus midgets.
Traveling midget tailors?
Yeah, ya think?
No.
So we're gay. How hard can that be?
It might not be hard for you, Rock Hudson, but I have got heterosex...
What?
'Not gay' written all over me.

[to the bully]
You come anywhere near these girls again, I won't say nothin'. I'm just gonna come over to your house late at night when you're asleep and kill you with a chainsaw.
The last man in that safe who didn't work here, my Daddy shot in his tracks.
I understand that's the most painful place to be shot in.
I guess like, like everybody I'm scared of bein', you know, rejected.
There's no way, man. You're a real catch, you're a man's man, a nice guy. You've got your health. And everybody knows what a turn-on that uniform is.
I guess I should be flattered by your stalking.
There's such a fine line between... stalking and, and being attentive, and I was - I don't know - going for being attentive.
That's what life's for, isn't it? Finding out?
[to Josephine through the prison fence]
Don't make me come after you, they'll shoot me!
Well I'll be dipped.
Great googely moogely!

[about Sheriff Dent]
That is one big dick cop.
Sheriff Dent. I just want to shake your hand. I wish there were more men like you in law enforcement. You are one big dick cop.
Thank you.

[talking to a group of marshals]
OK we've got three, count my fingers, three runners.
[holds a picture of Wayne]
First, Wayne Wayne Wayne Jr. This man likes to steal cars.
[holds up a picture of Harry]
Next, Harry Sawyer; fraud, credit card scam.
[holds up a picture of Maslow]
And the reason we are all here today, Bob Maslow. Let's put this guy away before he kills somebody else!
David! Somebody stole our crappy camper!

[while climbing out of the cab while towing the RV]
What are you DOING?

[while climbing out of the RV onto the towline]
I'm trying to save you!
Well, knock it off! I'm trying to save YOU!
